title: Ring of increase accuracy
data:
| =          |                                                               |   |   |
| ---------- | ------------------------------------------------------------- | - | - |
| Name       | increase accuracy                                             |   |   |
| Appearance | [random](/wiki/Randomised_appearance "Randomised appearance") |   |   |
| Base price | 150 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                             |   |   |
| Weight     | 3                                                             |   |   |

A **ring of increase accuracy** adds its [enchantment](/wiki/Enchantment "Enchantment") to your [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") rolls. The enchantment can be altered by [charging](/wiki/Charging "Charging"). Like the [ring of increase damage](/wiki/Ring_of_increase_damage "Ring of increase damage"), [it can be eaten](/wiki/Ring_eating "Ring eating") for a chance at obtaining an intrinsic accuracy bonus provided it is of an edible material.

## Identification

The ring is tricky to identify unless the player starts with it, however, as there is no message upon donning it. Using a source of [enlightenment](/wiki/Enlightenment "Enlightenment") can allow you to deduce that an unidentified ring is increase accuracy; there will be a line stating your bonus or penalty to hit.

Dropping this ring down a [sink](/wiki/Sink "Sink") produces the message "The water flow hits the drain." If the enchantment is negative, the following message appears: "The water flow misses the drain."

## Strategy

In the early game, weaker roles may benefit from the accuracy bonus while training weapons from [unskilled](/wiki/Skill "Skill") to basic. [Monks](/wiki/Monk "Monk") who decide to wear body armor may benefit from accuracy bonuses well into the middle game. For most other middle and late game characters, this ring is best used as [polyfodder](/wiki/Polyfodder "Polyfodder").

Eating the ring is rarely helpful, as eating jewelry generally requires [polymorph control](/wiki/Polymorph_control "Polymorph control"), which is hard to obtain in the early game.

## Variants

Although no NetHack variants change the function of this ring, it's worth noting that several variants have enemies with exceptionally high AC, such as [One-Eyed Sam](/wiki/One-Eyed_Sam "One-Eyed Sam") in [UnNethack](/wiki/UnNethack "UnNethack"), [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), and [DynaHack](/wiki/DynaHack "DynaHack") who often has AC -20 and below. Also of note, UnNetHack nerfs the bonus that luck gives to accuracy to Luck/3, while DynaHack removes it entirely. Ingesting or wearing rings of increase accuracy may prove useful in these cases.

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.1. Click here for more information.](/images/d/d3/Nh361-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.1. Click here for more information.")

**This page may need to be updated for the [current version](/wiki/Current_version "Current version") of *NetHack*.**

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.6.1](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.1 "NetHack 3.6.1"). Information on this page may be out of date.

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-361}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.

Ring of increase accuracy

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
=
Name increase accuracy
Appearance random
Base price 150 zm
Weight 3

A ring of increase accuracy adds its enchantment to your to-hit rolls. The enchantment can be altered by charging. Like the ring of increase damage, it can be eaten for a chance at obtaining an intrinsic accuracy bonus provided it is of an edible material.

Identification

The ring is tricky to identify unless the player starts with it, however, as there is no message upon donning it. Using a source of enlightenment can allow you to deduce that an unidentified ring is increase accuracy; there will be a line stating your bonus or penalty to hit.

Dropping this ring down a sink produces the message "The water flow hits the drain." If the enchantment is negative, the following message appears: "The water flow misses the drain."

Strategy

In the early game, weaker roles may benefit from the accuracy bonus while training weapons from unskilled to basic. Monks who decide to wear body armor may benefit from accuracy bonuses well into the middle game. For most other middle and late game characters, this ring is best used as polyfodder.

Eating the ring is rarely helpful, as eating jewelry generally requires polymorph control, which is hard to obtain in the early game.

Variants

Although no NetHack variants change the function of this ring, it's worth noting that several variants have enemies with exceptionally high AC, such as One-Eyed Sam in UnNethack, SLASH'EM, and DynaHack who often has AC -20 and below. Also of note, UnNetHack nerfs the bonus that luck gives to accuracy to Luck/3, while DynaHack removes it entirely. Ingesting or wearing rings of increase accuracy may prove useful in these cases.

This page may need to be updated for the current version of NetHack.

It may contain text specific to NetHack 3.6.1. Information on this page may be out of date.
